Class MerchandiseService

java.lang.Object
CSC540.WolfWR.services.Services<Merchandise,Long>
CSC540.WolfWR.services.MerchandiseService
@Transactional @Component public class MerchandiseService extends Services<Merchandise,Long>
Service class for managing Merchandise entities.

This service class provides methods for interacting with the data layer to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on Merchandise entities, using the MerchandiseRepository.

It extends the Services class to inherit common CRUD functionality and is annotated with Component to make it a Spring-managed bean. The Transactional annotation ensures that database operations are performed within a transaction context.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getRepo

      protected org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Merchandise,Long> getRepo()
      Returns the repository associated with Merchandise entities.

      This method overrides the Services.getRepo() method to provide the specific repository for Merchandise.

      Specified by:
      getRepo in class Services<Merchandise,Long>
      Returns:
      the MerchandiseRepository instance used to interact with Merchandise entities.

    • deliveriesByTimeAndSupplier

      public List<Merchandise> deliveriesByTimeAndSupplier(LocalDate start, LocalDate end, Supplier s)
      Retrieves a list of Merchandise delivered by a specific supplier within a given date range.

      This method calls the repository method MerchandiseRepository.deliveriesByTime(java.time.LocalDate, java.time.LocalDate, java.lang.Long) to fetch the list of merchandise delivered by the specified supplier during the given date range.

      Parameters:
      start - the start date of the delivery range.
      end - the end date of the delivery range.
      s - the Supplier whose deliveries are to be fetched.
      Returns:
      a list of Merchandise delivered by the specified supplier within the date range.

    • storeInventory

      public List<Merchandise> storeInventory(Store s)
      Retrieves a list of Merchandise available in a specific store.

      This method calls the repository method MerchandiseRepository.storeInventory(java.lang.Long) to fetch the list of merchandise available in the specified store that has a quantity greater than zero.

      Parameters:
      s - the Store whose inventory is to be fetched.
      Returns:
      a list of Merchandise available in the specified store.
